metadata.title: USN-6224-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that the XFS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform metadata validation when mounting certain images. An attacker could use this to specially craft a file system image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2023-2124)  Wei Chen discovered that the InfiniBand RDMA communication manager implementation in the Linux kernel contained an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2023-2176)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6224-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-headers-6.2.0-1007-aws - 6.2.0-1007.7 linux-tools-6.2.0-1007-aws - 6.2.0-1007.7 linux-buildinfo-6.2.0-1007-aws -
